DataElement.preferredName: Pathologic T Stage Colorectal Tumor Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the specific pathologic T stage type for a colorectal tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to pathologic T stage colorectal tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Property.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.
(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pathologic T Stage Colorectal Tumor Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the specific pathologic T stage type for a colorectal tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues; invades 5 mm or less beyond the border of the muscularis propria

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues; invades 5 mm or less beyond the border of the muscularis propria
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues; invades 5 mm or less beyond the border of the muscularis propria

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissue; invades greater than 5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissue; invades greater than 5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissue; invades greater than 5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria
Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
